p: The current chestnut global distribution is the consequence of natural colonization together with a long history of human intervention. Currently, the chestnut tree area worldwide is approximately 596 × 10 3 ha for fruit production, being Southern Europe, Southwestern United States of America, and Asia (Japan, Korean Peninsula, and East China) the main distribution regions [ 13]. According to Figure 1, in recent decades, chestnut world production has shown an upward trend (56 × 10 3 t yr −1) [ 14].
